title: Grace Hyland's Portfolio
text:
About Me
    Hello! My name is Grace Hyland, and I’m a Master's student in Data Science and Analytics at Georgetown University. I started my graduate studies while earning a Bachelor's in Biology of Global Health, which I completed in May 2024. With a strong foundation in both biological sciences and data-driven problem-solving, I’m passionate about using analytics to uncover insights and answer questions. I’m currently seeking early-career opportunities where I can apply my skills in data analysis and machine learning to address complex challenges. 
    When I’m not diving into data, you’ll likely find me cheering on Georgetown basketball, exploring new restaurants with friends, or out on a run, training for my next race.
  



  
    Coursework
    
    Big Data and Cloud Computing
    Database Systems and SQL
    Advanced Data Visualization
    Applied Generative AI
    Storytelling, Data Communication, and Decision Science
    Biological and Biomedical Data Science
    Data Science and Analytics
    
  
  
  
    Skills
    
      Data cleaning and processing (tidyverse, NumPy, Pandas)
      SQL and database management
      Data visualization (ggplot2, matplotlib, seaborn, Plotly, Tableau)
      Machine Learning in Python (scikit-learn)
      Cloud computing (AWS, PySpark, SparkNLP)

title: Grace Hyland's Portfolio
text:
Hello, and welcome to my portfolio! My name is Grace Hyland and I will be graduating with my MS in Data Science and Analytics this May (2025). Please explore my projects below! 



  
    
    Travel Advice From Reddit
    We used post and comment data from seven travel related subreddits to identify travel trends and consumer preferences. We employed NLP techniques to identify the most popular travel destinations and categorize these destinations based on additional information included in the posts. 
     Tools:  Amazon SageMaker, PySpark, SpaCy, SparkNLP, RegEx, Pandas, numpy
    View Project →
  
    
    
    Flight Counts and Delays
    Created a report from the Bureau of Transportation Statistics flight log for February of 2021. The report delivered insights on frequency of and distrubution of flights as well as delays and cancellations. I used SQL to aggregate and summarize the data and visualized these summaries using Tableau.
     Tools:  SQL, MySQL Workbench, Tableau 
    View Project →
  
  
    
    Power Play Analysis
    
    Explored using NHL player evaluation metrics during power play minutes as predictors for playoff berths. I used several supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms to classify teams based on these metrics. 
    
     Tools:  Pandas, numpy, scikit-learn
    View Project →
  
  
    
    Passenger Satisfaction
    We sought to identify the most important factors that contribute to whether or not passengers will be satisfied with their flight experience. We used various statistical models to generate predictions for passenger satisfaction. Through determining the most important factors we were able to provide recommendations to airlines for areas to focus on.
     Tools:  tidyverse, ggplot2, logistic regression 
    View Project →
  
  
    
    Type II Diabetes Syndemics
    We used NHANES survey data from the CDC to evaluate how demographic, dietary, life style, and laboratory factors affect Type II Diabetes diagnosis. We constructed stratified survival curves for many variables to identify those with significant differences between levels. We then evaluated how these significant variables interact with one another. 
     Tools:  survival analysis 
    View Project →
  
  
    
    Public Transportation Network Analysis
    Comparative analysis of the metro systems in Boston and Washington, DC to evauluate resiliency and efficiency of the network. I reconstructed both metro systems as graph objects in Python and calculated basic network metrics, identified the most critical stops, and analyzed passenger density througout the system.
     Tools:  NetworkX, geopandas, matplotlib 
    View Project →
